TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit NamespaceSupport extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.param: The prefix to declare, or the empty string to indicate the default element namespace. This may never have the value "xml" or "xmlns".
The Namespace URI to associate with the prefix.
Docs.returns: true if the prefix was legal, false otherwise

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Return one of the prefixes mapped to a Namespace URI.
Docs.returns: one of the prefixes currently mapped to the URI supplied, or null if none is mapped or if the URI is assigned to the default namespace

Docs.summary: Returns true if namespace declaration attributes are placed into a namespace. -or- Controls whether namespace declaration attributes are placed into the #NSDECL NSDECL namespace by #processName processName().
Docs.value: true if namespace declaration attributes are enabled, false otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string[]? ProcessName (string? qName, string[]? parts, bool isAttribute);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string[] ProcessName(string qName, string[] parts, bool isAttribute) cil managed
Public Overridable Function ProcessName (qName As String, parts As String(), isAttribute As Boolean) As String()
public: virtual cli::array <System::String ^> ^ ProcessName(System::String ^ qName, cli::array <System::String ^> ^ parts, bool isAttribute);
abstract member ProcessName : string * string[] * bool -> string[] override this.ProcessName : string * string[] * bool -> string[]

Docs.param: The XML qualified name to be processed.
An array supplied by the caller, capable of holding at least three members.
A flag indicating whether this is an attribute name (true) or an element name (false).
Docs.summary: Process a raw XML qualified name, after all declarations in the current context have been handled by #declarePrefix declarePrefix().
Docs.returns: The supplied array holding three internalized strings representing the Namespace URI (or empty string), the local name, and the XML qualified name; or null if there is an undeclared prefix.
